column4: hey does anyone know how to get https pages working in ubuntu
.... well it doesn't work for me :(
are you serving https?
are you running a server on your machine?  ...or are you just trying to browse?
that sounds like a browser specific problem, not ubuntu.. i'm not sure I know what your problem is.. sorry
have you tried any other browsers?
how about galeon? (apt-get install galeon)
it's based on mozilla as well
any luck?
its finished downloadining and now installing
what is the error you get??
i dont know what is happening then..gmail is working here.. so unless you have some sort of firewall or proxy blocking you i dont know
could the problem be hardware based?
i doubt it..never heard of a hardware problem like that
are you on a different network than your other computers (such as you're on wifi and the others are on lan)
yeah.. sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart
and every other website (non-https) works?
yes
i did about:config, where should i go from there?
all i can think of... does it allow you to login if you boot from the livecd??
it has always worked "out of the box" every ubuntu (or any distro) installation i've ever done.. so i don't know what to suggest
if you cant connect on the network you have, then a proxy wont help.. really a proxy would be to limit what can pass through
oh okay.
sorry i couldnt help further.. if i run across anything i'll let you know
